00030 class bstmap

00046   class Node  {
00047   public:
00048     Node (value_type val, Node* parent = NULL,  Node* left = NULL, Node* right = NULL) :
00049       value_m(val), parent_m(parent), left_m(left), right_m(right) {}
00050 
00051     value_type value_m;
00052     Node* parent_m;
00053     Node* left_m;
00054     Node* right_m;
00055 
00056     ~Node() {
00057       // Don't delete because this Node does not "own" the others
00058       parent_m = NULL;
00059       left_m = NULL;
00060       right_m = NULL;
00061     }
00062   };

00067   template<typename _T>
00068   class _iterator 
00069   {
00070   public:
00071     typedef input_iterator_tag iterator_category;
00072     typedef _T value_type;
00073     typedef int difference_type;
00074     typedef value_type* pointer;
00075     typedef value_type& reference;
00076 
00077     friend class bstmap;
00078     friend class Node;
00079     
00080     _iterator() : map_m(NULL), node_m(NULL) {}
00081     _iterator(const bstmap* map, Node* n = NULL) : map_m(map), node_m(n) {}
00082     _iterator(const _iterator& x) : map_m(x.map_m), node_m(x.node_m) {}
00083     
00084     _iterator& operator=(const _iterator& x)
00085     {
00086       map_m = x.map_m;
00087       node_m = x.node_m;
00088       return *this;

00091     reference operator*() const
00092     {
00093       try {
00094         if (node_m == NULL) {
00095           // throw runtime_error("Cannot access Node; Node is null");
00096           cerr << "ERROR: Cannot access Node; Node is NULL" << endl;
00097         }
00098         
00099         return node_m->value_m;
00100       } catch (runtime_error& e) {
00101         throw;
00102       }
00103     }

00106     {
00107       try {
00108         if (node_m == NULL) {
00109           // throw runtime_error("Cannot access Node; Node is null");
00110           cerr << "ERROR: Cannot access Node; Node is NULL" << endl;
00111         }
00112 
00113         return &(node_m->value_m);
00114       } catch (runtime_error& e) {
00115         throw;
00116       }
00117     }
00118 
00119     // Static operator== for const to const iterator and variants.
00120     //  friend equality comparision operators to allow for "static"
00121     friend bool operator==(const _iterator& x, const _iterator& y) 
00122     {
00123       return (x.node_m == y.node_m);
00124     }
00125 
00126     friend bool operator!=(const _iterator& x, const _iterator& y)
00127     {
00128       return (x.node_m != y.node_m);
00129     }

00132     {
00133       try {
00134         if (map_m == NULL) {
00135           // throw runtime_error("Cannot access map; map is null");
00136           cerr << "Cannot access map; map is NULL" << endl;
00137         }
00138 
00139         node_m = map_m->_successor(node_m);
00140         return *this;
00141       } catch (runtime_error& e) {
00142         throw;
00143       }
00144     }

00147     {

00150       return temp;

00171   // overload copy constructor to do a deep copy
00172   bstmap(const Self& x) 
00173     : root_m(NULL)
00174   {
00175     for (const_iterator i = x.begin(); i != x.end(); ++i) {
00176       insert(*i); // Insert value at x's i
00177     }
00178   }
00179 
00180   // overload assignment to do a deep copy
00181   Self& operator=(const Self& x) 
00182   {
00183     // guard against self assignment
00184     if (this == &x) {
00185       return (*this);
00186     }
00187 
00188     clear();
00189 
00190     for (const_iterator i = x.begin(); i != x.end(); ++i) {
00191       insert(*i); // Insert value at x's i
00192     }    
00193   }

00196   iterator begin() 
00197   {
00198     return iterator(this, _leftmost_node());
00199   }

00201   const_iterator begin() const 
00202   {
00203     return const_iterator(this, _leftmost_node());
00204   }
00205   
00206   iterator end() 
00207   {
00208     if (empty()) { 
00209       // Return same as begin if is empty;
00210       return begin();
00211     } else {
00212       // Null wrapper. "Point past-the-end"
00213       return iterator(this, NULL);
00214     }
00215   }
00216 
00217   const_iterator end() const 
00218   {
00219     if (empty()) { 
00220       // Return same as begin if is empty;
00221       return begin();
00222     } else {
00223       // Null wrapper. "Point past-the-end"
00224       return const_iterator(this, NULL);
00225     }
00226   }
00227 
00228   bool empty() const 
00229   {
00230     return root_m == NULL;
00231   }
00232 
00233   size_type size() const 
00234   {
00235     return _size(root_m);

00238   pair<iterator, bool> insert(const value_type& x) 
00239   {
00240     Node* ret_n;
00241     bool ret_b;
00242     pair<Node*, bool> my_pair = _find(x.first, root_m);
00243 
00244     if (my_pair.second == true) {
00245       // means value is already in tree
00246       ret_b = false;
00247       ret_n = my_pair.first;
00248     } else if (my_pair.first == NULL) {
00249       // First Node insertaion
00250       ret_n = root_m = new Node(x);
00251       ret_b = true;
00252     } else {
00253       // create and insert new node
00254       Node* new_node = new Node(x, my_pair.first);
00255       if (x.first < (my_pair.first->value_m).first) {
00256         ret_n = my_pair.first->left_m = new_node;      
00257       } else {
00258         ret_n = my_pair.first->right_m = new_node;
00259       }
00260       ret_b = true;
00261     }
00262     
00263     return pair<iterator, bool>(iterator(this, ret_n), ret_b);
00264   }
00265 
00266   void erase(iterator pos) 
00267   {
00268     if (pos == NULL) {
00269       // throw runtime_error("Cannot erase NULL");
00270       cerr << "ERROR: Cannot erase NULL" << endl;
00271     }
00272 
00273     Node* del = pos.node_m;
00274     Node* del_parent = del->parent_m;
00275 
00276     // Case 3: Has two children:
00277     //   goal: to turn into one or zero children left.
00278     if (del->left_m && del->right_m) {
00279       // "Move" predecessor's value to del's by creating 
00280       //    a new Node with the new value and del's old pointers;
00281       Node* predecessor = _predecessor(del);
00282       Node* replacement = new Node(predecessor->value_m, del_parent, del->left_m, del->right_m);
00283 
00284       
00285       if (del_parent) {
00286         // Has parents
00287         if (del_parent->left_m == del) {
00288           del_parent->left_m = replacement;
00289         } else {
00290           del_parent->right_m = replacement;
00291         }
00292       } else {
00293         // No parents (is root_m)
00294         root_m = replacement;
00295       }
00296       
00297       if (del->left_m) {
00298         del->left_m->parent_m = replacement;
00299       }
00300       if (del->right_m) {
00301         del->right_m->parent_m = replacement;
00302       }
00303 
00304       delete del;
00305       // Let erase handle unknown case for predecessor.
00306       erase(iterator(this, predecessor));
00307     } else if (del->left_m == NULL && del->right_m == NULL) {
00308       // Case 1: No Child, simply delete.
00309       if (del == root_m) {
00310         // If is root
00311         delete del;
00312         root_m = NULL;
00313       } else {
00314         // if not root, must have parent.
00315         if (del == del_parent->left_m) {
00316           del_parent->left_m = NULL;
00317         } else {
00318           del_parent->right_m = NULL;
00319         }
00320 
00321         delete del;
00322       }
00323     } else {
00324       // case 2: has only one child;
00325 
00326       if (del == root_m) {
00327         // has one child, is root.
00328         Node* old_child;
00329 
00330         if (del->left_m) {
00331           // if has left child;
00332           old_child = del->left_m;
00333         } else {
00334           // Must have right child;
00335           old_child = del->right_m;
00336         } 
00337 
00338         delete root_m;
00339         root_m = old_child;
00340         root_m->parent_m = NULL;
00341 
00342       } else if (del != root_m) {
00343         // has one child, is not root, i.e. has parent.
00344         Node* old_child;
00345 
00346         if (del->left_m) {
00347           // if has left child;
00348           old_child = del->left_m;
00349         } else {
00350           // Must have right child;
00351           old_child = del->right_m;
00352         } 
00353 
00354         if (del == del_parent->left_m) {
00355           // del is parent's left child;
00356           del_parent->left_m = old_child;
00357         } else {
00358           // del is parent's right child;
00359           del_parent->right_m = old_child;
00360         }
00361        
00362         old_child->parent_m = del_parent;
00363         delete del;
00364       } else {
00365         // Exists for ultra-safety.
00366         // throw runtime_error("ERROR: Impossible erase case...");
00367         cerr << "ERROR: impossible erase case..." << endl;
00368       }
00369     }
00370   }
00371 
00372   // return number of given keys deleted
00373   //   should either be 0 or 1 in bstmap.
00374   size_type erase(const Key& x)
00375   {
00376     iterator it(find(x));
00377     
00378     if (it == end()) { 
00379       // Key not found
00380       return 0;
00381     } else {
00382       erase(it);
00383       // since Key in bstmaps are unique, can only be 1
00384       return 1; 
00385     }
00386   }
00387   
00388   void clear() 
00389   {
00390     _recursive_delete(root_m);
00391     root_m = NULL;
00392   }

00394   // map operations:
00395   iterator find(const Key& x) 
00396   {
00397     pair<Node*, bool> my_pair = _find(x, root_m);
00398 
00399     if (my_pair.second) { // Key was found.
00400       return iterator(this, my_pair.first);
00401     } else {
00402       return end();
00403     }
00404   }
00405 
00406   const_iterator find(const Key& x) const 
00407   {
00408     pair<Node*, bool> my_pair = _find(x, root_m);
00409 
00410     if (my_pair.second) { // Key was found.
00411       return const_iterator(this, my_pair.first);
00412     } else {
00413       return end();
00414     }
00415   }

00423   size_type count(const Key& x) const 
00424   {
00425     // find(x) returns end() if not found.
00426     if (find(x) != end()) {
00427       return 1;
00428     } else {
00429       return 0;
00430     }
00431   }
00432 
00433   T& operator[](const Key& k) 
00434   {
00435     iterator it = find(k);
00436     
00437     if (it != end()) {   
00438       // found key
00439       return (*it).second;
00440     } else {               
00441       // not found --> create new empty
00442       insert( value_type(k, T()));
00443       return (*this)[k];
00444     }
00445   }

00458   {
00459     return iterator(this, _rightmost_node());
00460   }

00467   // Private functions for internal helping.
00468 private:
00469   // Finds a Node from given key and subtree.
00470   //   returns a Node pointer and bool pair
00471   //   bool holds if given key was found in map.
00472   pair<Node*, bool> _find(const key_type& key, Node* const subtree, Node* const parent = NULL) const 
00473   {
00474     if (subtree == NULL) {
00475       return pair<Node*, bool>(parent, false);
00476     } 
00477 
00478     if (subtree->value_m.first == key) {
00479       return pair<Node*, bool>(subtree, true);
00480     } else if (subtree->value_m.first > key) {
00481       return _find(key, subtree->left_m, subtree);
00482     } else {
00483       return _find(key, subtree->right_m, subtree);
00484     }
00485   }
00486 
00487   // Returns a pointer to the leftmost node.
00488   //   if head is unspecified, assume start at root.
00489   Node* _leftmost_node(Node* const head = NULL) const
00490   {
00491     Node* curr = head;
00492     
00493     if (curr == NULL) {
00494       curr = root_m;
00495     }
00496 
00497     if (curr != NULL) {
00498       while (curr->left_m != NULL) {
00499         curr = curr->left_m;
00500       }
00501     }
00502 
00503     return curr;    
00504   }
00505 
00506   // Returns a pointer to the rightmost node.
00507   //   if head is unspecificed, assume start at root.
00508   Node* _rightmost_node(Node* const head = NULL) const
00509   {
00510     Node* curr = head;
00511 
00512     if (curr == NULL) {
00513       curr = root_m;
00514     }
00515 
00516     if (curr != NULL) {
00517       while (curr->right_m != NULL) {
00518         curr = curr->right_m;
00519       }
00520     }
00521 
00522     return curr;
00523   }
00524 
00525   
00526   // returns the successor of a Node.
00527   Node* _successor(Node* const n) const
00528   {
00529     if (n == NULL) {
00530       // throw runtime_error("Cannot success NULL");
00531       cerr << "Cannot success NULL" << endl;
00532     }
00533 
00534     // If node has a right child,
00535     //   successor is the min(node.right)
00536     if (n->right_m) {
00537       return _leftmost_node(n->right_m);
00538     } else {
00539       Node* curr = n;
00540       Node* parent = n->parent_m;
00541 
00542       // successor is the parent where node is right child of parent.
00543       while (parent != NULL && curr == parent->right_m) {
00544         curr = parent;
00545         parent = parent->parent_m;
00546       }
00547 
00548       return parent;
00549     }
00550   }
00551 
00552   // Predecessor is the largest element in the left subtree from n.
00553   Node* _predecessor(Node* const n) const
00554   {
00555     if (n == NULL) {
00556       // throw runtime_error("Cannot predecess NULL");
00557       cerr << "Cannot predecess NULL" << endl;
00558     } else if (n == _leftmost_node()) { 
00559       // throw runtime_error("Cannot predecess lowest node.");
00560       cerr << "Cannot predecess lowest node" << endl;
00561     }
00562     
00563     if (n->left_m) {
00564       // Predecessor is the largest element in left subtree.
00565       return _rightmost_node(n->left_m);
00566     } else {
00567       return n->parent_m;
00568     }
00569   }
00570 
00571   // recursively delete left, then right, then myself.
00572   void _recursive_delete(Node* n) 
00573   {
00574     if (n != NULL) {
00575       _recursive_delete(n->left_m);
00576       _recursive_delete(n->right_m);
00577 
00578       delete n;
00579       n = NULL;
00580     }
00581   }
00582 
00583   // Gets size of left tree + right tree + 1 (root)
00584   size_type _size(Node* const n) const 
00585   {
00586     if (n == NULL) {
00587       return 0;
00588     } else {
00589       // root + size(left), + size(right)
00590       return 1 + _size(n->left_m) + _size(n->right_m);
00591     }
00592   }
00593 };
